meanings.definition: A person who dominates or controls others.
meanings.sent1: The playground dominator always told others what to do.
meanings.sent2: The team captain was a natural dominator, leading the group to victory.
meanings.sent3: The dominator of the office snack stash was caught red-handed stealing cookies.
meanings.sent4: The dominator of the chessboard strategically captured all the opponent's pieces.
meanings.sent5: The dominator of the dance floor moved with confidence and skill.

meanings.definition: A ruler or leader who exercises power or authority over others.
meanings.sent1: The ancient king was known as a fierce dominator of his kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The political dominator made decisions that affected the entire nation.
meanings.sent3: The dominator of the remote control refused to share it with anyone else.
meanings.sent4: The dominator of the battlefield led his troops to victory against all odds.
meanings.sent5: The dominator of the classroom always had the attention of the students.

meanings.definition: A device or machine that controls or regulates a system.
meanings.sent1: The thermostat acts as a dominator of the room's temperature.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light functions as a dominator of the intersection, directing vehicles.
meanings.sent3: The dominator of the coffee maker ensures the perfect brew every time.
meanings.sent4: The dominator of the security system alerts authorities in case of any breach.
meanings.sent5: The dominator of the assembly line keeps production running smoothly.
